title: Woman convicted of fraud after living under a stolen identity for more than 20 years
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Lina Maria Orovio-Hernandez, 59, convicted of identity theft and voter fraud after using a stolen identity for over 20 years.
Orovio-Hernandez illegally obtained approximately $400,000 in benefits, including Section 8 and Social Security payments, using false identities.
She faces potential deportation and up to 10 years in prison for her offenses, including aggravated identity theft and fraudulent voting.

title: Celtics rally from 22 down in Vucevic’s debut to beat Heat: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 11 points and grabbed 12 rebounds in his Celtics debut, helping the team rally to beat the Miami Heat 98-96.
The Celtics overcame a 21-point halftime deficit with a second-half surge, including contributions from Payton Pritchard's 19 points off the bench.
Coach Joe Mazzulla admitted to over-preparing, but simplification helped the team adapt and win, pushing them to second place in the standings.

title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially stated he wasn't supporting the Patriots in the Super Bowl LX, focusing on their new chapter.
Brady later expressed support for Patriots owner Robert Kraft on Instagram, encouraging the team to win a seventh ring.
Brady's initial comments drew backlash from former teammate Vince Wilfork and Patriots player Robert Spillane.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Jeff Saturday believes Drake Maye deserved NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford, citing Maye's dual-threat capability and stats.
Maye had a 6-0 record and better QBR against common opponents compared to Stafford's 4-2 record.
ESPN analyst Mina Kimes supported Maye's MVP candidacy, highlighting his efficiency and rushing ability versus Stafford.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots plan to pressure Seahawks QB Sam Darnold, who struggles under blitzes despite recent playoff success.
Seahawks defense ranks high in multiple categories, but Patriots QB Drake Maye could exploit scrambling opportunities.
Patriots' Robert Spillane is a game-time decision, impacting New England's defense against Seattle's strong run game.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots QB Drake Maye has no injury designation and is expected to play in the Super Bowl.
Linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are questionable for the Patriots due to knee and ankle injuries, respectively.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is questionable with a hamstring injury but participated fully in practices.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water,' starring Chris Pine, is streaming on Netflix as part of the latest must-watch recommendations.
'Splitsville,' a 2025 romantic comedy featuring Kyle Marvin and Dakota Johnson, is available on Hulu.
The 2026 Winter Olympics in Italy are streaming on Peacock, featuring NBC's Gold Zone coverage.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs inspired the New England Patriots with the phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' during a pregame speech.
New England embraced Diggs's words, uniting fans and players, contributing to a successful season and a Super Bowl appearance.
Diggs, facing legal issues, remains a vocal leader; his message and leadership resonate deeply with the Patriots team.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris, a North Attleboro resident, is running her first marathon at the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Demeris is raising funds for the Massachusetts General Hospital Fund, supporting emergency response, cancer research, and veterans' programs.
Her motivations include her roles as a responder's wife and daughter of a breast cancer survivor.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets will close its South End location in June after 28 years, prompting community dissatisfaction.
Originally, Croft School planned to take the space, but withdrew due to neighborhood objections.
The closure is due to costly building updates, with no plans for another grocer at 1421 Washington St.
